channel.title: Ozone Pollution
channel.description: Updated Ozone Pollution content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: 2008 Ozone National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS) Findings of Failure to Submit
item.description:
This final action finds that 15 states and the District of Columbia have failed to submit specific state implementation plan (SIP) elements to satisfy certain nonattainment area, and/or Ozone Transport Region (OTR), planning requirements for the 2008 ozone National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS). The delinquent SIP elements in this finding of failure to submit include reasonable achievable control technology (RACT) for oxides of nitrogen (NOX) applicable to major sources, non-control techniques guidelines (non-CTG) RACT for volatile organic compounds (VOC) applicable to major sources, CTG VOC RACT (including all 44 CTGs), Nonattainment New Source Review, Basic Vehicle Inspection and Maintenance, Vehicle Miles Traveled and Transportation Control Measures to Offset Growth, and Clean Fuels for Boilers.

  • Findings of Failure to Submit State Implementation Plan Submittals for the 2008 Ozone National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS) (prepublication) (PDF)(20 pp, 137 K)
  • Fact Sheet: Findings of Failure to Submit State Implementation Plan Submittals for the 2008 Ozone National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS) (PDF)(3 pp, 192 K)
item.dc:creator: jcortely

item.title: 2008 Ozone National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS) Section 176A Petitions
item.description:
On January 11, 2017, EPA proposed to deny a petition from Connecticut, Delaware, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, New York, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island and Vermont under section 176A(a) of the Clean Air Act (CAA). The petition asks the EPA to add Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Michigan, North Carolina, Ohio, Tennessee, West Virginia and a portion of Virginia to the Ozone Transport Region (OTR), alleging that these states significantly contribute to violations of the 2008 ozone national ambient air quality standards (NAAQS) in the OTR.

Response to December 9, 2013, Clean Air Act Section 176A Petition From Connecticut, Delaware, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, New York, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island and Vermont

  • Fact Sheet: Response to December 9, 2013, Clean Air Act Section 176A Petition From Connecticut, Delaware, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, New York, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island and Vermont (PDF)(2 pp, 41 K)
item.dc:creator: jcortely

item.title: Delaware Section 126 Petition (January 2017)
item.description:
On January 9, 2017, EPA extended by six months the deadline to respond to a petition submitted by the state of Delaware under section 126 of the Clean Air Act. The petition requests that EPA make a finding that the Conemaugh Generating Station located in Indiana County, Pennsylvania, is emitting air pollutants that significantly contribute to nonattainment or interfere with maintenance of the 2008 and 2015 ozone national ambient air quality standards in Delaware.

  • Notice for Extension of Deadline for Action on the November 28, 1026 Section 126 Petition from Delaware (PDF)(9 pp, 72 K)
  • Fact Sheet: Notice for Extension of Deadline for Action on the November 28, 1026 Section 126 Petition from Delaware (PDF)(1 pg, 40 K)
item.dc:creator: jcortely

item.title: Delaware 126 Petition (September 2016)
item.description:
On September 19, 2016, EPA extended by six months the deadline to respond to a petition submitted by the state of Delaware under section 126 of the Clean Air Act.

The petition requests that EPA make a finding that the Harrison power station located near Haywood, Harrison County, West Virginia, is emitting air pollutants that significantly contribute to nonattainment or interfere with maintenance of the 2008 ozone national ambient air quality standards (NAAQS) and the 2015 ozone NAAQS in Delaware.

  • Extension Notice
  • Fact Sheet for Extension of Deadline for Second Section 126 Petition from Delaware (PDF)(1 pg, 40 K)
item.dc:creator: jcortely

item.title: Delaware 126 Petition (August 2016)
item.description:
On August 15, 2016, EPA extended by six months the deadline to respond to a petition submitted by the state of Delaware under section 126 of the Clean Air Act.
 
The petition requests that EPA make a finding that the Brunner Island Steam Electric Station in York County, Pennsylvania, is emitting air pollutants that significantly contribute to nonattainment or interfere with maintenance of the 2008 ozone national ambient air quality standards (NAAQS) and the 2015 ozone NAAQS in Delaware.
 
  • Extension Notice
  • Fact Sheet for DE 126 Extension (PDF)(1 pg, 33 K)
item.dc:creator: jcortely

item.title: Connecticut 126 Petition
item.description:
On July 14, 2016, EPA extended by six months the deadline to respond to a petition submitted by the Connecticut Department of Energy and Environmental Protection under section 126 of the Clean Air Act.
 
The petition requests that EPA make a finding that the Brunner Island Steam Electric Station in York County, Pennsylvania, is emitting air pollutants that significantly contribute to nonattainment or interfere with maintenance of the 2008 ozone national ambient air quality standards (NAAQS) in Connecticut.
 
  • Extension Notice
  • Fact Sheet for CT 126 Extension (PDF)(1 pg, 74 K)
item.dc:creator: jcortely

item.title: Ozone Implementation Regulatory Actions
item.description:
The Clean Air Act requires EPA to set National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS) for six criteria pollutants; ozone pollution is one of these.  EPA works with partners at state, local, and tribal air quality agencies to meet these standards.

The following list provides a collection of rules and guidance documents for implementation the more recent ozone standards:

  • Ozone (2015)
  • Ozone (2008)
  • To find implementation information and guidance documents see Ozone (1997)
  • General Preamble for the Implementation of Title 1 of the Clean Air Act Amendments of 1990

To see a table of all of the Ozone NAAQS visit our Ozone National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS) page.
item.dc:creator: msouth

item.title: Proposed Nonattainment Area Classifications and State Implementation Plan Requirements
item.description:
The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is proposing requirements for implementing the strengthened National Ambient Air Quality Standards for ozone that were promulgated on October 1, 2015.

  • December 7, 2016 Webinar Recording
  • December 7, 2016 Webinar Slides (PDF)(14 pp, 215 K)
  • Fact Sheet: Proposed Requirements for Implementing the 2015 Ozone Standards (PDF)(3 pp, 39 K)
  • Announcement of Public Hearing and Extension of Public Comment Period (Prepublication) (PDF)(6 pp, 86 K)
  • List of Registered Speakers - January 12, 2017 Public Hearing (PDF)(1 pg, 15 K)
item.dc:creator: jcortely
